text:
Astralis vs VICI Gaming. Forecast and rate of Alexander Petrick
06 Nov 2019, 17:53 by Alexander Petrick
Alexander Petrick, a professional e-sports analyst at CQ, a regular participant in the analytics studio at SLTV-covered tournaments, gave a prediction for the Astralis vs VICI Gaming match to be held at the IEM Beijing 2019 tournament.

06:00, 07 Nov 2019

In the opening match at IEM Beijing, rivals of the local ViCi team came across one of the best fives on the planet - Astralis.
The Danes a week ago performed at the BLAST Pro Series in their native Copenhagen, where they didn't look like themselves on the first game day. I have not seen this in the history of this team for a long time, but the moral comeback on the second game day led to the Scandinavians being able to win two matches out of three, and to reduce the third meeting to a draw. In general, Astralis is also a failure, they are people too
ViCi is by far not the most titled club in China, which is already there to talk about its achievements on the world stage. The biggest success of this team is the sensational exit to the main part of the IEM Katowice 2019 major: after the third place in the Asian minorities in the status of Play-In outsider, the team was able to unexpectedly beat North for all and get themselves a pass in the top 24 of the main tournament of the year. There are currently 4 people playing in ViCi. On the Chinese scene, they are still in the top, but occasionally concede in the battle for the highest places.
There is no point in this match to win Astralis, because the odds are just ridiculous. However, I can imagine a scenario where a team from Europe, even being such a clear favorite as now Astralis, loses one card or even two because of jetlag and illness (by the way, BLAST, by the way, the device experienced some problems). So in this match I put ViCi with a head start (+1.5). I think it is possible.
